titleStmt.title: A group of people is waiting at a counter

editionStmt.edition: Picturing Migrants Lives - Jovan Ritopečki’s photographic documentation of Yugoslav labour migration in Austria (1970–89)

authority.orgName: Institute Centre for Information Modelling - Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities

publicationStmt.ref: Workers in front of the Yugoslav Consulate

sourceDesc.ab: The first part of the photo series shows a group of Yugoslav workers (mostly men) waiting in front of the Yugoslav consulate and then entering its courtyard. Three insciptions on the wall (two seem to be official titles of the institution in different languages, while the third probably gives practical information) and the street number 4a can be seen at the main entrance. The people are dressed for the colder part of the year: wearing coats, some men wearing hats, and some women wearing headscarfs. Most of the people are facing the entrance of the building, while a few look at the camera. The second part shows the group entering the main building, then entering a second door from the courtyard and at the end, waiting in front of a counter with passports and documents in their hands.
The photos were taken in front of and inside Salmgasse 4a (3. Bezirk)
The series is consisted of two parts. The photographs have limited sharpness (details in the background, such as inscriptions, cannot be read).

objectContents.ab: Twelve people can be seen, as they wait in front of a counter, in a room inside the consulate. The first person next to the counter is a woman, the others are men. Many have their passports and documents ready. The people are standing very close to each other and are focused on the counter. On the first photo with this motive only one man looks at the camera, while on the second there are six people turned to the camera. The clerk behind the counter cannot be seen, because the window is darkened/blurred. Only his/her hand can be seen in the second pic, holding papers.

The picture implies a small space, because it captures an angle of a room, and people are too crowded next to each other. This time the photographer positioned sideways to the group. In the second picture of this motive, half of the people look or even seem to interract with the camera. Perhaps the photographer asked in some way for their attention.
